snippet: The “Nebraska” production sought nonprofessionals via announcements on rural radio, it was revealed at a Producers Guild panel. At the same session, Woody Allen’s longtime producer explained how he figures out where to set his films: where he...
abstract: The “Nebraska” production sought nonprofessionals via announcements on rural radio, it was revealed at a Producers Guild panel. At the same session, Woody Allen’s longtime producer explained how he figures out where to set his films: where he can stand to live for the 10 weeks of filming.

headline.main: Casting 'Nebraska' Via Radio and Other Producing Secrets
